content.description: Just to the right of jaws and left of the finger crack. Start on slab and head straight up and topout over the bulge. Tight topout. The reach is extremely arm length dependent. Head slightly right for shorter arms.
content.location: Just to the right of jaws and left of the finger crack. Slab in the middle.

content.description: Start at Serpentine Traverse and move directly up on the blunt arete.
Really fun traverse with lots of great movement. Even if you don't like traverses, try this one!
content.protection: Crash pad and spotter for the topout.
content.location: Start the same as Jaws in the right arching crack, but cut left on obvious pockets and seam. Head up when you reach Serpentine Crack (the obvious line).

content.description: A good, obvious route that’s in the guide but not on MP yet. Follow a juggy crack straight up to a sloping topout. Fun holds and worth the time.
content.location: On the Little Cave Wall, before the right leaning crack. A vertical, chalked crack.

content.description: The most obvious line on the boulder that for whatever reason isn't in any of the guides. follow the right arching crack from the bottom to the top, a very easy boulder problem, the top out is probably the crux
content.protection: pads, climb is very easy but watch for tree roots if you hop off
content.location: this is the line on the wall, the obvious huge right arching crack that ends in the same spot as the straight up finger crack

content.description: Fun problem with a committing finish! Great moves through the roof.
content.protection: Crash pad and a spotter, especially for the topout.
content.location: Originates in right arching crack. pockets and thin seam angle left out roof.

content.description: Start low on the wide hueco, but move up on slopers through a slab topout (V4).
content.protection: Crashpads. Landing slopes away quite a bit.
content.location: The first climb of Little Cave. Marked by a large bulge.

content.description: Fun little problem.  Start in the crack and follow it to large holds at the top.
content.location: Route is the obvious small crack to the right of the very large one.

content.description: Slabby climb starts on two pockets, step up and reach for jug slightly to the right.
content.location: Farthest right route in Little Cave. Directly under cedar tree 15-20 feet right of The Chin.

content.description: Another really good, really easy, really obvious climb that doesn't seem to be documented, even though it is often climbed. Just before little cave proper is a hard to miss pretty slab you can top out right or left of a large capstone above the boulder A fun but dirty variation starts seated in pockets to the left of the slab, could be topped out directly but I traverse into the typical slab top out as its direct top out is dirty and I am lazy
content.protection: pad, not very tall and the landing is good
content.location: walking in from the parking you will pass the obvious clean slab just before the little cave

content.description: Short.  Climb in the corner to the large holds under and over the roof.
content.location: Just to the right of Bozo...about 35 feet from the cave with the large, right-leaning crack.

content.description: Starts low with two good pockets and reaches straight up (if you're tall, to the left if you're not so tall) over the bulge.
content.location: The problem is located about 30 feet to the right of the large, right-leaning crack and just to the left of a smaller cave with a small roof.

content.description: This wall is identifiable by the very large right-leaning crack with the roof.  There are a few problems here of varying difficulty (V0 - V4).  It gets some sun in the morning (in winter).
